    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-align: center;">SOLVENTUM CORPORATION</div>
    <div style="text-align: center;">5.400% Senior Notes due 2029</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zc2244c9c545a464b8f8deab618639410" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">1.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Interest</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Solventum Corporation (the &#8220;<u>Company</u>&#8221;) promises to pay interest on the principal amount of this Note at the rate per annum described above.&#160; Cash interest on the Notes will accrue from, and including, the most
      recent date to which interest has been paid; or, if no interest has been paid, from February 27, 2024.&#160; Interest on this Note will be paid to, but excluding, the relevant Interest Payment Date or on such earlier date as the principal amount shall
      become due in accordance with the provisions hereof.&#160; The Company will pay interest semi-annually in arrears on each Interest Payment Date, beginning on September 1, 2024, and on the Stated Maturity.&#160; If any Interest Payment Date, Stated Maturity&#160; or
      other payment date with respect to the Notes is not a Business Day, then payment of principal, premium, if any, and interest shall be made on the next succeeding Business Day with the same force and effect as if made on the date such payment was due,
      and no interest on such payment shall accrue on that payment for the period from and after such Interest Payment Date, Stated Maturity or other payment date, as the case may be, to the date of that payment on the next succeeding Business Day.&#160;
      Interest will be computed on the basis of a 360-day year consisting of twelve 30-day months.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Company shall pay interest on overdue principal from time to time on demand at the rate borne by the Notes and at the same rate on overdue installments of interest (without regard to any applicable grace periods) to
      the extent lawful from the dates such amounts are due until such amounts are paid or made available for payment.&#160; All references to any amount of interest or any other amount payable on or with respect to the Notes shall be deemed to include payment
      of any interest payable as a consequence of the occurrence and continuation of a &#8220;Registration Default,&#8221; if applicable, as defined in the Registration Rights Agreement, dated as February 27, 2024, among the Company, the Guarantor and the
      representatives of the initial purchasers with respect to the Initial Notes party thereto.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zb1a3d0da6c124c8da8046b86aa0d642e" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">2.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Paying Agent</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Initially, U.S. Bank Trust Company, National Association (the &#8220;<u>Trustee</u>&#8221;) will act as paying agent.&#160; The Company may change any paying agent without notice to the Holders.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zb2fd85a7e4db433387c6a8d60d63177e" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">3.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Indenture; Defined Terms</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">This Note is one of the 5.400% Senior Notes due 2029 (the &#8220;<u>Notes</u>&#8221;) issued under the Indenture, dated as of February 27, 2024 (as amended, modified or supplemented from time to time in accordance therewith, the &#8220;<u>Base



        Indenture</u>&#8221; and, as supplemented by the First Supplemental Indenture, dated as of February 27, 2024, the &#8220;<u>Indenture</u>&#8221;), by and between the Company and the Trustee, as trustee.&#160; This Note is a &#8220;Security&#8221; and the Notes are &#8220;Securities&#8221; under
      the Indenture.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
        <hr noshade="noshade" style="margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; border-width: 0; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; clear: both;"></div>
    </div>
    <!--PROfilePageNumberReset%Num%2%-%-%-->
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">For purposes of this Note, unless otherwise defined herein, capitalized terms herein are used as defined in the Indenture.&#160; The terms of the Notes include those stated in the Indenture and those made part of the
      Indenture by reference to the Trust Indenture Act of 1939 (15 U.S.C. Sections 77aaa-77bbbb) (the &#8220;<u>TIA</u>&#8221;) as in effect on the date on which the Indenture is qualified under the TIA.&#160; Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Notes are
      subject to all such terms, and holders of Notes are referred to the Indenture and the TIA for a statement of them.&#160; To the extent the terms of the Indenture and this Note are inconsistent, the terms of the Indenture shall govern.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="ze330c634275b4421a9b4747c6c29eec1" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">4.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Denominations; Transfer; Exchange</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Notes are in registered form, without coupons, in denominations of $2,000 and integral multiples of $1,000 in excess thereof.&#160; A Holder shall register the transfer or exchange of Notes in accordance with the
      Indenture.&#160; The Company may require a Holder, among other things, to furnish appropriate endorsements and transfer documents and to pay certain transfer taxes or similar governmental charges payable in connection therewith as permitted by the
      Indenture.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z042fe406912e47af95dc1eca1232ae6c" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">5.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Amendment; Modification; Waiver</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Subject to certain exceptions, with the consent of the Holders of not less than a majority in principal amount of the Outstanding Securities of all series affected by such supplemental indenture or amendment (treated as
      one class), by Act of said Holders delivered to the Company and the Trustee, the Company, when authorized by a Board Resolution, and the Trustee may enter into an indenture or indentures supplemental to the Indenture and/or amendments to any related
      guarantee agreement for the purpose of adding any provisions to or changing in any manner or eliminating any of the provisions of the Indenture or any such guarantee agreement or of modifying in any manner the rights of the Holders of Securities of
      such series under the Indenture or any such guarantee agreement.&#160; Without notice to or the consent of any Holder, the Company and the Trustee may amend or supplement the Indenture or the Notes to, among other things, cure any ambiguity, or correct or
      supplement any provision therein which may be defective or inconsistent with any other provision therein.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z302779b03adc4f3faf341525b1b46e5e" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">6.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Optional Redemption; Special Mandatory Redemption; Offer to Repurchase Upon Change of Control Repurchase Event</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Notes are subject to optional redemption, special mandatory redemption and may be the subject of a Change of Control Offer, in each case as further described in the Indenture.&#160; There is no sinking fund applicable to
      the Notes.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z2cfbbe73899a4cb58a9f464eab7f869e" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">7.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Defaults and Remedies</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">If an Event of Default with respect to the Notes occurs and is continuing, then in every such case the Trustee or the Holders of not less than 25% in principal amount of the Outstanding Notes may declare the principal
      amount of all the Notes to be due and payable immediately, by a notice in writing to the Company (and to the Trustee if given by Holders), and upon any such declaration such principal amount (or specified amount) shall become immediately due and
      payable.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
      <div style="text-align: center;" class="BRPFPageNumberArea"><font style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">-2-</font></div>
      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
        <hr noshade="noshade" style="margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; border-width: 0; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; clear: both;"></div>
    </div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Indenture permits, subject to certain limitations therein provided, Holders of not less than a majority in principal amount of the Outstanding Notes to direct the time, method and place of conducting any proceeding
      for any remedy available to the Trustee, or exercising any trust or power conferred on the Trustee, with respect to the Notes.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zf539bdcdf946472c912c274b71ae5f1c" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">8.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Authentication</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">This Note shall not be valid until the Trustee or any Authenticating Agent signs the certificate of authentication on this Note by manual or PDF or other electronically imaged (such as DocuSign or Adobe Sign) signature.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z36e1f9cdd5b14d00a80aa3a98df4d854" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">9.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Abbreviations and Defined Terms</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Customary abbreviations may be used in the name of a Holder of a Note or an assignee, such as:&#160; TEN COM (= tenants in common), TEN ENT (= tenants by the entireties), JT TEN (= joint tenants with right of survivorship and
      not as tenants in common), CUST (= Custodian), and U/G/M/A (= Uniform Gifts to Minors Act).</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z19fd169e275f41ba833848342767fbbc" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">10.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>CUSIP Numbers</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">No representation is made as to the accuracy of CUSIP or ISIN numbers as printed on the Notes.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="za2f9cc8f03be4128bbc74932e1c4478e" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>

          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">11.</td>

    </table>

    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The undersigned represents and warrants that it is purchasing this Note for its own account or an account with respect to which it exercises sole investment discretion and that it and any such account is a &#8220;qualified
      institutional buyer&#8221; within the meaning of Rule 144A, and is aware that the sale to it is being made in reliance on Rule 144A and acknowledges that it has received such information regarding the Company as the undersigned has requested pursuant to
      Rule 144A or has determined not to request such information and that it is aware that the transferor is relying upon the undersigned&#8217;s foregoing representations in order to claim the exemption from registration provided by Rule 144A.</div>

    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The undersigned represents and warrants that (i) it is an institutional &#8220;accredited investor&#8221; (as defined in Rule 501(a)(1), (2), (3) or (7) under the Securities Act, purchasing for its own account or for the account of
      such an institutional &#8220;accredited investor&#8221; at least $100,000 principal amount of the Notes, and it is acquiring the Notes not with a view to, or for offer or sale in connection with, any distribution in violation of the Securities Act, (ii) it has
      such knowledge and experience in financial and business matters as to be capable of evaluating the merits and risks of our investment in the Notes and invest in or purchase securities similar to the Notes in the normal course of its business and
      (iii) it and any accounts for which it is acting, are each able to bear the economic risk of its and their investment.</div>

    <div style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">REPURCHASE EXERCISE NOTICE UPON A CHANGE OF CONTROL</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>To:&#160; Solventum Corporation</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;">The undersigned registered owner of this Security hereby acknowledges receipt of a notice from Solventum Corporation (the &#8220;<u>Company</u>&#8221;) as to the occurrence of a Change of Control Repurchase Event with respect to the
      Company and hereby directs the Company to pay, or cause the Trustee to pay, ____________________ an amount in cash equal to 101% of the aggregate principal amount of the Notes, or the portion thereof (which is $2,000 principal amount or an integral
      multiple of $1,000 in excess thereof) below designated, to be repurchased plus accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the repurchase date, except as provided in the Indenture.&#160; The undersigned hereby agrees that the Notes will be repurchased
      as of the Change of Control Payment Date pursuant to the terms and conditions thereof and the Indenture.</div>

    <div style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">FORM OF 2031 NOTES</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>[<font style="font-style: italic;">RESTRICTED NOTES ONLY</font>] [THIS SECURITY HAS NOT BEEN REGISTERED UNDER THE U.S. SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, AS AMENDED (THE &#8220;SECURITIES ACT&#8221;), OR THE SECURITIES LAWS OF ANY STATE OR OTHER JURISDICTION AND,
      ACCORDINGLY, MAY NOT BE OFFERED OR SOLD WITHIN THE UNITED STATES OR TO, OR FOR THE ACCOUNT OR BENEFIT OF, U.S. PERSONS EXCEPT AS SET FORTH BELOW.&#160; BY ITS ACQUISITION HEREOF, THE HOLDER (1) REPRESENTS THAT (A) IT IS A &#8220;QUALIFIED INSTITUTIONAL BUYER&#8221;
      (AS DEFINED IN RULE 144A UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT), OR (B) IT IS NOT A U.S. PERSON AND IS ACQUIRING THIS SECURITY IN AN OFFSHORE TRANSACTION IN COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATION S UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT, (2) AGREES THAT IT WILL NOT WITHIN [IN THE CASE OF
      RULE 144A NOTES:&#160; ONE YEAR] [IN THE CASE OF REGULATION S NOTES:&#160; 40 DAYS] AFTER THE LATER OF THE ORIGINAL ISSUE DATE HEREOF AND THE LAST DATE ON WHICH THE ISSUER OR ANY AFFILIATE OF THE ISSUER WAS THE OWNER OF THIS SECURITY (OR ANY PREDECESSOR OF
      SUCH SECURITY) RESELL OR OTHERWISE TRANSFER THIS SECURITY EXCEPT (A) TO THE ISSUER OR ANY SUBSIDIARY THEREOF, (B) INSIDE THE UNITED STATES TO A QUALIFIED INSTITUTIONAL BUYER IN COMPLIANCE WITH RULE 144A UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT OR TO AN INSTITUTIONAL
      &#8220;ACCREDITED INVESTOR&#8221; (AS DEFINED IN RULE 501(A)(1), (2), (3) OR (7) OF REGULATION D UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT), (C) OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES IN AN OFFSHORE TRANSACTION IN COMPLIANCE WITH RULE 903 OR RULE 904 UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT, (D) PURSUANT TO
      THE EXEMPTION FROM REGISTRATION PROVIDED BY RULE 144 UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT (IF AVAILABLE), (E) IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANOTHER EXEMPTION FROM THE REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS OF THE SECURITIES ACT (AND BASED UPON AN OPINION OF COUNSEL IF THE ISSUER SO
      REQUESTS), OR (F) PURSUANT TO AN EFFECTIVE REGISTRATION STATEMENT UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT AND (3) AGREES THAT IT WILL GIVE TO EACH PERSON TO WHOM THIS SECURITY IS TRANSFERRED A NOTICE SUBSTANTIALLY TO THE EFFECT OF THIS LEGEND.&#160; AS USED HEREIN, THE
      TERMS &#8220;OFFSHORE TRANSACTION,&#8221; &#8220;UNITED STATES&#8221; AND &#8220;U.S. PERSON&#8221; HAVE THE MEANING GIVEN TO THEM BY REGULATION S UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT.]</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>[<font style="font-style: italic;">GLOBAL NOTES ONLY</font>] [UNLESS THIS CERTIFICATE IS PRESENTED BY AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF THE DEPOSITORY TRUST COMPANY, A NEW YORK CORPORATION (&#8220;DTC&#8221;), NEW YORK, NEW YORK, TO THE COMPANY OR ITS AGENT FOR
      REGISTRATION OF TRANSFER, EXCHANGE OR PAYMENT, AND ANY CERTIFICATE ISSUED IS REGISTERED IN THE NAME OF CEDE &amp; CO. OR SUCH OTHER NAME AS IS REQUESTED BY AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF DTC (AND ANY PAYMENT IS MADE TO CEDE &amp; CO., OR TO SUCH
      OTHER ENTITY AS IS REQUESTED BY AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF DTC), ANY TRANSFER, PLEDGE OR OTHER USE HEREOF FOR VALUE OR OTHERWISE BY OR TO ANY PERSON IS WRONGFUL INASMUCH AS THE REGISTERED OWNER HEREOF, CEDE &amp; CO., HAS AN INTEREST HEREIN.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>

    <div>TRANSFERS OF THIS GLOBAL SECURITY SHALL BE LIMITED TO TRANSFERS IN WHOLE, BUT NOT IN PART, TO DTC, TO NOMINEES OF DTC OR TO A SUCCESSOR THEREOF OR SUCH SUCCESSOR&#8217;S NOMINEE AND TRANSFERS OF PORTIONS OF THIS GLOBAL SECURITY SHALL BE LIMITED TO
      TRANSFERS MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE RESTRICTIONS SET FORTH IN THE INDENTURE REFERRED TO ON THE REVERSE HEREOF.]</div>

      OFFSHORE TRANSACTION IN ACCORDANCE WITH REGULATION S UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT.]</div>

          <td style="width: 50%; vertical-align: top;">&#160;</td>
          <td style="width: 5%; vertical-align: top;">&#160;</td>
          <td style="width: 45%; vertical-align: top;">&#160;</td>
        </tr>

          <td style="width: 50%; vertical-align: top; padding-bottom: 2px;">&#160;</td>

            <div>By:</div>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 45%; vertical-align: top; border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);"><br>

      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">

    </div>
    <div style="text-align: center;">(REVERSE OF NOTE)</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-align: center;">SOLVENTUM CORPORATION</div>
    <div style="text-align: center;">5.450% Senior Notes due 2031</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z3f4ef541b29246afa6312a2f05fcab54" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">1.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Interest</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Solventum Corporation (the &#8220;<u>Company</u>&#8221;) promises to pay interest on the principal amount of this Note at the rate per annum described above.&#160; Cash interest on the Notes will accrue from, and including, the most
      recent date to which interest has been paid; or, if no interest has been paid, from February 27, 2024.&#160; Interest on this Note will be paid to, but excluding, the relevant Interest Payment Date or on such earlier date as the principal amount shall
      become due in accordance with the provisions hereof.&#160; The Company will pay interest semi-annually in arrears on each Interest Payment Date, beginning on September 13, 2024, and on the Stated Maturity.&#160; If any Interest Payment Date, Stated Maturity or
      other payment date with respect to&#160; the Notes is not a Business Day, then payment of principal, premium, if any, and interest shall be made on the next succeeding Business Day with the same force and effect as if made on the date such payment was
      due, and no interest on such payment shall accrue on that payment for the period from and after such Interest Payment Date, Stated Maturity or other payment date, as the case may be, to the date of that payment on the next succeeding Business Day.&#160;
      Interest will be computed on the basis of a 360-day year consisting of twelve 30-day months.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Company shall pay interest on overdue principal from time to time on demand at the rate borne by the Notes and at the same rate on overdue installments of interest (without regard to any applicable grace periods) to
      the extent lawful from the dates such amounts are due until such amounts are paid or made available for payment.&#160; All references to any amount of interest or any other amount payable on or with respect to the Notes shall be deemed to include payment
      of any interest payable as a consequence of the occurrence and continuation of a &#8220;Registration Default,&#8221; if applicable, as defined in the Registration Rights Agreement, dated as February 27, 2024, among the Company, the Guarantor and the
      representatives of the initial purchasers with respect to the Initial Notes party thereto.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z9a0a990731124951ae0de11c6ff4caab" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">2.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Paying Agent</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Initially, U.S. Bank Trust Company, National Association (the &#8220;<u>Trustee</u>&#8221;) will act as paying agent.&#160; The Company may change any paying agent without notice to the Holders.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z3f92004986d14fcbab390d9ac76570a6" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">3.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Indenture; Defined Terms</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">This Note is one of the 5.450% Senior Notes due 2031 (the &#8220;<u>Notes</u>&#8221;) issued under the Indenture, dated as of February 27, 2024 (as amended, modified or supplemented from time to time in accordance therewith, the &#8220;<u>Base



        Indenture</u>&#8221; and, as supplemented by the First Supplemental Indenture, dated as of February 27, 2024, the &#8220;<u>Indenture</u>&#8221;), by and between the Company and the Trustee, as trustee.&#160; This Note is a &#8220;Security&#8221; and the Notes are &#8220;Securities&#8221; under
      the Indenture.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
        <hr noshade="noshade" style="margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; border-width: 0; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; clear: both;"></div>
    </div>
    <!--PROfilePageNumberReset%Num%2%-%-%-->
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">For purposes of this Note, unless otherwise defined herein, capitalized terms herein are used as defined in the Indenture.&#160; The terms of the Notes include those stated in the Indenture and those made part of the
      Indenture by reference to the Trust Indenture Act of 1939 (15 U.S.C. Sections 77aaa-77bbbb) (the &#8220;<u>TIA</u>&#8221;) as in effect on the date on which the Indenture is qualified under the TIA.&#160; Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Notes are
      subject to all such terms, and holders of Notes are referred to the Indenture and the TIA for a statement of them.&#160; To the extent the terms of the Indenture and this Note are inconsistent, the terms of the Indenture shall govern.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z5cdfb888a19c43ac99232df68de9d5f2" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">4.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Denominations; Transfer; Exchange</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Notes are in registered form, without coupons, in denominations of $2,000 and integral multiples of $1,000 in excess thereof.&#160; A Holder shall register the transfer or exchange of Notes in accordance with the
      Indenture.&#160; The Company may require a Holder, among other things, to furnish appropriate endorsements and transfer documents and to pay certain transfer taxes or similar governmental charges payable in connection therewith as permitted by the
      Indenture.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z2ee26517266e4bfda31065a13424407e" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">5.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Amendment; Modification; Waiver</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Subject to certain exceptions, with the consent of the Holders of not less than a majority in principal amount of the Outstanding Securities of all series affected by such supplemental indenture or amendment (treated as
      one class), by Act of said Holders delivered to the Company and the Trustee, the Company, when authorized by a Board Resolution, and the Trustee may enter into an indenture or indentures supplemental to the Indenture and/or amendments to any related
      guarantee agreement for the purpose of adding any provisions to or changing in any manner or eliminating any of the provisions of the Indenture or any such guarantee agreement or of modifying in any manner the rights of the Holders of Securities of
      such series under the Indenture or any such guarantee agreement.&#160; Without notice to or the consent of any Holder, the Company and the Trustee may amend or supplement the Indenture or the Notes to, among other things, cure any ambiguity, or correct or
      supplement any provision therein which may be defective or inconsistent with any other provision therein.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z749f31926dc8425f9122f89b1507d39f" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">6.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Optional Redemption; Special Mandatory Redemption; Offer to Repurchase Upon Change of Control Repurchase Event</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Notes are subject to optional redemption, special mandatory redemption and may be the subject of a Change of Control Offer, in each case as further described in the Indenture.&#160; There is no sinking fund applicable to
      the Notes.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z82bc03a63525488cad7a0ed0d05e2dc7" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">7.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Defaults and Remedies</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">If an Event of Default with respect to the Notes occurs and is continuing, then in every such case the Trustee or the Holders of not less than 25% in principal amount of the Outstanding Notes may declare the principal
      amount of all the Notes to be due and payable immediately, by a notice in writing to the Company (and to the Trustee if given by Holders), and upon any such declaration such principal amount (or specified amount) shall become immediately due and
      payable.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
      <div style="text-align: center;" class="BRPFPageNumberArea"><font style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">-2-</font></div>
      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
        <hr noshade="noshade" style="margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; border-width: 0; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; clear: both;"></div>
    </div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Indenture permits, subject to certain limitations therein provided, Holders of not less than a majority in principal amount of the Outstanding Notes to direct the time, method and place of conducting any proceeding
      for any remedy available to the Trustee, or exercising any trust or power conferred on the Trustee, with respect to the Notes.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z608f713ad7ca4e17b200045d8e016729" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">This Note shall not be valid until the Trustee or any Authenticating Agent signs the certificate of authentication on this Note by manual or PDF or other electronically imaged (such as DocuSign or Adobe Sign) signature.</div>

    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Customary abbreviations may be used in the name of a Holder of a Note or an assignee, such as:&#160; TEN COM (= tenants in common), TEN ENT (= tenants by the entireties), JT TEN (= joint tenants with right of survivorship and
      not as tenants in common), CUST (= Custodian), and U/G/M/A (= Uniform Gifts to Minors Act).</div>

          <td style="width: 5.42%; vertical-align: top;">

              institutional buyer and to whom notice is given that such transfer is being made in reliance on Rule 144A, in each case pursuant to and in compliance with Rule 144A; or</div>

    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The undersigned represents and warrants that it is purchasing this Note for its own account or an account with respect to which it exercises sole investment discretion and that it and any such account is a &#8220;qualified
      institutional buyer&#8221; within the meaning of Rule 144A, and is aware that the sale to it is being made in reliance on Rule 144A and acknowledges that it has received such information regarding the Company as the undersigned has requested pursuant to
      Rule 144A or has determined not to request such information and that it is aware that the transferor is relying upon the undersigned&#8217;s foregoing representations in order to claim the exemption from registration provided by Rule 144A.</div>

    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The undersigned represents and warrants that (i) it is an institutional &#8220;accredited investor&#8221; (as defined in Rule 501(a)(1), (2), (3) or (7) under the Securities Act, purchasing for its own account or for the account of
      such an institutional &#8220;accredited investor&#8221; at least $100,000 principal amount of the Notes, and it is acquiring the Notes not with a view to, or for offer or sale in connection with, any distribution in violation of the Securities Act, (ii) it has
      such knowledge and experience in financial and business matters as to be capable of evaluating the merits and risks of our investment in the Notes and invest in or purchase securities similar to the Notes in the normal course of its business and
      (iii) it and any accounts for which it is acting, are each able to bear the economic risk of its and their investment</div>

    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;">The undersigned registered owner of this Security hereby acknowledges receipt of a notice from Solventum Corporation (the &#8220;<u>Company</u>&#8221;) as to the occurrence of a Change of Control Repurchase Event with respect to the
      Company and hereby directs the Company to pay, or cause the Trustee to pay, ____________________ an amount in cash equal to 101% of the aggregate principal amount of the Notes, or the portion thereof (which is $2,000 principal amount or an integral
      multiple of $1,000 in excess thereof) below designated, to be repurchased plus accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the repurchase date, except as provided in the Indenture.&#160; The undersigned hereby agrees that the Notes will be repurchased
      as of the Change of Control Payment Date pursuant to the terms and conditions thereof and the Indenture.</div>

    <div style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">FORM OF 2034 NOTES</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>[<font style="font-style: italic;">RESTRICTED NOTES ONLY</font>] [THIS SECURITY HAS NOT BEEN REGISTERED UNDER THE U.S. SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, AS AMENDED (THE &#8220;SECURITIES ACT&#8221;), OR THE SECURITIES LAWS OF ANY STATE OR OTHER JURISDICTION AND,
      ACCORDINGLY, MAY NOT BE OFFERED OR SOLD WITHIN THE UNITED STATES OR TO, OR FOR THE ACCOUNT OR BENEFIT OF, U.S. PERSONS EXCEPT AS SET FORTH BELOW.&#160; BY ITS ACQUISITION HEREOF, THE HOLDER (1) REPRESENTS THAT (A) IT IS A &#8220;QUALIFIED INSTITUTIONAL BUYER&#8221;
      (AS DEFINED IN RULE 144A UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT), OR (B) IT IS NOT A U.S. PERSON AND IS ACQUIRING THIS SECURITY IN AN OFFSHORE TRANSACTION IN COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATION S UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT, (2) AGREES THAT IT WILL NOT WITHIN [IN THE CASE OF
      RULE 144A NOTES:&#160; ONE YEAR] [IN THE CASE OF REGULATION S NOTES:&#160; 40 DAYS] AFTER THE LATER OF THE ORIGINAL ISSUE DATE HEREOF AND THE LAST DATE ON WHICH THE ISSUER OR ANY AFFILIATE OF THE ISSUER WAS THE OWNER OF THIS SECURITY (OR ANY PREDECESSOR OF
      SUCH SECURITY) RESELL OR OTHERWISE TRANSFER THIS SECURITY EXCEPT (A) TO THE ISSUER OR ANY SUBSIDIARY THEREOF, (B) INSIDE THE UNITED STATES TO A QUALIFIED INSTITUTIONAL BUYER IN COMPLIANCE WITH RULE 144A UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT OR TO AN INSTITUTIONAL
      &#8220;ACCREDITED INVESTOR&#8221; (AS DEFINED IN RULE 501(A)(1), (2), (3) OR (7) OF REGULATION D UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT), (C) OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES IN AN OFFSHORE TRANSACTION IN COMPLIANCE WITH RULE 903 OR RULE 904 UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT, (D) PURSUANT TO
      THE EXEMPTION FROM REGISTRATION PROVIDED BY RULE 144 UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT (IF AVAILABLE), (E) IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANOTHER EXEMPTION FROM THE REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS OF THE SECURITIES ACT (AND BASED UPON AN OPINION OF COUNSEL IF THE ISSUER SO
      REQUESTS), OR (F) PURSUANT TO AN EFFECTIVE REGISTRATION STATEMENT UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT AND (3) AGREES THAT IT WILL GIVE TO EACH PERSON TO WHOM THIS SECURITY IS TRANSFERRED A NOTICE SUBSTANTIALLY TO THE EFFECT OF THIS LEGEND.&#160; AS USED HEREIN, THE
      TERMS &#8220;OFFSHORE TRANSACTION,&#8221; &#8220;UNITED STATES&#8221; AND &#8220;U.S. PERSON&#8221; HAVE THE MEANING GIVEN TO THEM BY REGULATION S UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT.]</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>[<font style="font-style: italic;">GLOBAL NOTES ONLY</font>] [UNLESS THIS CERTIFICATE IS PRESENTED BY AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF THE DEPOSITORY TRUST COMPANY, A NEW YORK CORPORATION (&#8220;DTC&#8221;), NEW YORK, NEW YORK, TO THE COMPANY OR ITS AGENT FOR
      REGISTRATION OF TRANSFER, EXCHANGE OR PAYMENT, AND ANY CERTIFICATE ISSUED IS REGISTERED IN THE NAME OF CEDE &amp; CO. OR SUCH OTHER NAME AS IS REQUESTED BY AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF DTC (AND ANY PAYMENT IS MADE TO CEDE &amp; CO., OR TO SUCH
      OTHER ENTITY AS IS REQUESTED BY AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF DTC), ANY TRANSFER, PLEDGE OR OTHER USE HEREOF FOR VALUE OR OTHERWISE BY OR TO ANY PERSON IS WRONGFUL INASMUCH AS THE REGISTERED OWNER HEREOF, CEDE &amp; CO., HAS AN INTEREST HEREIN.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
        <hr noshade="noshade" style="margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; border-width: 0; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; clear: both;"></div>
    </div>
    <!--PROfilePageNumberReset%Num%2%-%-%-->
    <div>TRANSFERS OF THIS GLOBAL SECURITY SHALL BE LIMITED TO TRANSFERS IN WHOLE, BUT NOT IN PART, TO DTC, TO NOMINEES OF DTC OR TO A SUCCESSOR THEREOF OR SUCH SUCCESSOR&#8217;S NOMINEE AND TRANSFERS OF PORTIONS OF THIS GLOBAL SECURITY SHALL BE LIMITED TO
      TRANSFERS MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE RESTRICTIONS SET FORTH IN THE INDENTURE REFERRED TO ON THE REVERSE HEREOF.]</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>[<font style="font-style: italic;">REGULATION S NOTES ONLY</font>] [BY ITS ACQUISITION HEREOF, THE HOLDER HEREOF REPRESENTS THAT IT IS NOT A U.S. PERSON, NOR IS IT PURCHASING FOR THE ACCOUNT OF A U.S. PERSON, AND IS ACQUIRING THIS SECURITY IN AN
      OFFSHORE TRANSACTION IN ACCORDANCE WITH REGULATION S UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT.]</div>
    <div> <br>
    </div>

    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;">SOLVENTUM CORPORATION, a Delaware corporation (the &#8220;<u>Company</u>&#8221;), for value received promises to pay to [&#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; ] or registered assigns the principal sum of [&#9679;] on March 23, 2034 (the &#8220;<u>Stated Maturity</u>&#8221;).</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;">Interest Payment Dates:&#160; March 23 and September 23 (each, an &#8220;<u>Interest Payment Date</u>&#8221;),<u>&#160;</u>commencing on September 23, 2024, and upon the Stated Maturity.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;">Interest Record Dates:&#160; March 8 and September 8 (each, a &#8220;<u>Regular Record Date</u>&#8221;).</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;">Reference is made to the further provisions of this Note contained herein, which will for all purposes have the same effect as if set forth at this place.</div>

    <div style="text-align: center;">5.600% Senior Notes due 2034</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zd30b710b02314c058bf9dded4e8b15c4" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">1.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Interest</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Solventum Corporation (the &#8220;<u>Company</u>&#8221;) promises to pay interest on the principal amount of this Note at the rate per annum described above.&#160; Cash interest on the Notes will accrue from, and including, the most
      recent date to which interest has been paid; or, if no interest has been paid, from February 27, 2024.&#160; Interest on this Note will be paid to, but excluding, the relevant Interest Payment Date or on such earlier date as the principal amount shall
      become due in accordance with the provisions hereof.&#160; The Company will pay interest semi-annually in arrears on each Interest Payment Date, beginning on September 23, 2024, and on the Stated Maturity.&#160; If any Interest Payment Date, Stated Maturity or
      other payment date with respect to the Notes is not a Business Day, then payment of principal, premium, if any, and interest shall be made on the next succeeding Business Day with the same force and effect as if made on the date such payment was due,
      and no interest on such payment shall accrue on that payment for the period from and after such Interest Payment Date, Stated Maturity or other payment date, as the case may be, to the date of that payment on the next succeeding Business Day.&#160;
      Interest will be computed on the basis of a 360-day year consisting of twelve 30-day months.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Company shall pay interest on overdue principal from time to time on demand at the rate borne by the Notes and at the same rate on overdue installments of interest (without regard to any applicable grace periods) to
      the extent lawful from the dates such amounts are due until such amounts are paid or made available for payment.&#160; All references to any amount of interest or any other amount payable on or with respect to the Notes shall be deemed to include payment
      of any interest payable as a consequence of the occurrence and continuation of a &#8220;Registration Default,&#8221; if applicable, as defined in the Registration Rights Agreement, dated as February 27, 2024, among the Company, the Guarantor and the
      representatives of the initial purchasers with respect to the Initial Notes party thereto.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z311e601fcf3c4d7f81b86602e9e53699" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">2.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Paying Agent</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Initially, U.S. Bank Trust Company, National Association (the &#8220;<u>Trustee</u>&#8221;) will act as paying agent.&#160; The Company may change any paying agent without notice to the Holders.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zc398ca66833b440ca542af49b5741416" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">3.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">

          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">This Note is one of the 5.600% Senior Notes due 2034 (the &#8220;<u>Notes</u>&#8221;) issued under the Indenture, dated as of February 27, 2024 (as amended, modified or supplemented from time to time in accordance therewith, the &#8220;<u>Base



        Indenture</u>&#8221; and, as supplemented by the First Supplemental Indenture, dated as of February 27, 2024, the &#8220;<u>Indenture</u>&#8221;), by and between the Company and the Trustee, as trustee.&#160; This Note is a &#8220;Security&#8221; and the Notes are &#8220;Securities&#8221; under
      the Indenture.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
        <hr noshade="noshade" style="margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; border-width: 0; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; clear: both;"></div>
    </div>
    <!--PROfilePageNumberReset%Num%2%-%-%-->
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">For purposes of this Note, unless otherwise defined herein, capitalized terms herein are used as defined in the Indenture.&#160; The terms of the Notes include those stated in the Indenture and those made part of the
      Indenture by reference to the Trust Indenture Act of 1939 (15 U.S.C. Sections 77aaa-77bbbb) (the &#8220;<u>TIA</u>&#8221;) as in effect on the date on which the Indenture is qualified under the TIA.&#160; Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Notes are
      subject to all such terms, and holders of Notes are referred to the Indenture and the TIA for a statement of them.&#160; To the extent the terms of the Indenture and this Note are inconsistent, the terms of the Indenture shall govern.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z303f1d9f6383407b838235128ca27b4a" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">4.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Denominations; Transfer; Exchange</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Notes are in registered form, without coupons, in denominations of $2,000 and integral multiples of $1,000 in excess thereof.&#160; A Holder shall register the transfer or exchange of Notes in accordance with the
      Indenture.&#160; The Company may require a Holder, among other things, to furnish appropriate endorsements and transfer documents and to pay certain transfer taxes or similar governmental charges payable in connection therewith as permitted by the
      Indenture.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z7a0352a9e3cf49afa23cdd5ee0258b84" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">5.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Amendment; Modification; Waiver</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Subject to certain exceptions, with the consent of the Holders of not less than a majority in principal amount of the Outstanding Securities of all series affected by such supplemental indenture or amendment (treated as
      one class), by Act of said Holders delivered to the Company and the Trustee, the Company, when authorized by a Board Resolution, and the Trustee may enter into an indenture or indentures supplemental to the Indenture and/or amendments to any related
      guarantee agreement for the purpose of adding any provisions to or changing in any manner or eliminating any of the provisions of the Indenture or any such guarantee agreement or of modifying in any manner the rights of the Holders of Securities of
      such series under the Indenture or any such guarantee agreement.&#160; Without notice to or the consent of any Holder, the Company and the Trustee may amend or supplement the Indenture or the Notes to, among other things, cure any ambiguity, or correct or
      supplement any provision therein which may be defective or inconsistent with any other provision therein.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="ze111c8c6f4b9497dbde18b942f505066" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">6.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Optional Redemption; Special Mandatory Redemption; Offer to Repurchase Upon Change of Control Repurchase Event</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Notes are subject to optional redemption, special mandatory redemption and may be the subject of a Change of Control Offer, in each case as further described in the Indenture.&#160; There is no sinking fund applicable to
      the Notes.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zccfd8ab7dd5b470eb7285022254edcff" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">7.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Defaults and Remedies</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">If an Event of Default with respect to the Notes occurs and is continuing, then in every such case the Trustee or the Holders of not less than 25% in principal amount of the Outstanding Notes may declare the principal
      amount of all the Notes to be due and payable immediately, by a notice in writing to the Company (and to the Trustee if given by Holders), and upon any such declaration such principal amount (or specified amount) shall become immediately due and
      payable.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
      <div style="text-align: center;" class="BRPFPageNumberArea"><font style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">-2-</font></div>
      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
        <hr noshade="noshade" style="margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; border-width: 0; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; clear: both;"></div>
    </div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Indenture permits, subject to certain limitations therein provided, Holders of not less than a majority in principal amount of the Outstanding Notes to direct the time, method and place of conducting any proceeding
      for any remedy available to the Trustee, or exercising any trust or power conferred on the Trustee, with respect to the Notes.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z3c64237c4da54ccb8433c2113dcc23b7" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">This Note shall not be valid until the Trustee or any Authenticating Agent signs the certificate of authentication on this Note by manual or PDF or other electronically imaged (such as DocuSign or Adobe Sign) signature.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z58f1d01c56dd4b81b76062b6d1733807" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">9.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Abbreviations and Defined Terms</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Customary abbreviations may be used in the name of a Holder of a Note or an assignee, such as:&#160; TEN COM (= tenants in common), TEN ENT (= tenants by the entireties), JT TEN (= joint tenants with right of survivorship and
      not as tenants in common), CUST (= Custodian), and U/G/M/A (= Uniform Gifts to Minors Act).</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z1faedf1c86934b4fadbeda82551bba5f" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">10.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>CUSIP Numbers</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">No representation is made as to the accuracy of CUSIP or ISIN numbers as printed on the Notes.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">11.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Governing Law</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">This Note shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the law of the State of New York without regard to conflicts of laws principles thereof.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>

    <div>&#160;</div>

    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>I or we assign and transfer this Note to</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="margin-left: 72pt;">(Print or type assignee&#8217;s name, address and zip code)</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="margin-left: 72pt;">(Insert assignee&#8217;s soc. sec. or tax I.D. No.)</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>and irrevocably appoint agent to transfer this Note on the books of the Company.&#160; The agent may substitute another to act for her.</div>

      Rule 144A or has determined not to request such information and that it is aware that the transferor is relying upon the undersigned&#8217;s foregoing representations in order to claim the exemption from registration provided by Rule 144A.</div>

    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The undersigned represents and warrants that (i) it is an institutional &#8220;accredited investor&#8221; (as defined in Rule 501(a)(1), (2), (3) or (7) under the Securities Act, purchasing for its own account or for the account of
      such an institutional &#8220;accredited investor&#8221; at least $100,000 principal amount of the Notes, and it is acquiring the Notes not with a view to, or for offer or sale in connection with, any distribution in violation of the Securities Act, (ii) it has
      such knowledge and experience in financial and business matters as to be capable of evaluating the merits and risks of our investment in the Notes and invest in or purchase securities similar to the Notes in the normal course of its business and
      (iii) it and any accounts for which it is acting, are each able to bear the economic risk of its and their investment.</div>

    <div style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">REPURCHASE EXERCISE NOTICE UPON A CHANGE OF CONTROL</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>To:&#160; Solventum Corporation</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 36pt;">The undersigned registered owner of this Security hereby acknowledges receipt of a notice from Solventum Corporation (the &#8220;<u>Company</u>&#8221;) as to the occurrence of a Change of Control Repurchase Event with respect to the
      Company and hereby directs the Company to pay, or cause the Trustee to pay, ____________________ an amount in cash equal to 101% of the aggregate principal amount of the Notes, or the portion thereof (which is $2,000 principal amount or an integral
      multiple of $1,000 in excess thereof) below designated, to be repurchased plus accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the repurchase date, except as provided in the Indenture.&#160; The undersigned hereby agrees that the Notes will be repurchased
      as of the Change of Control Payment Date pursuant to the terms and conditions thereof and the Indenture.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>

    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>[<font style="font-style: italic;">RESTRICTED NOTES ONLY</font>] [THIS SECURITY HAS NOT BEEN REGISTERED UNDER THE U.S. SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, AS AMENDED (THE &#8220;SECURITIES ACT&#8221;), OR THE SECURITIES LAWS OF ANY STATE OR OTHER JURISDICTION AND,
      ACCORDINGLY, MAY NOT BE OFFERED OR SOLD WITHIN THE UNITED STATES OR TO, OR FOR THE ACCOUNT OR BENEFIT OF, U.S. PERSONS EXCEPT AS SET FORTH BELOW.&#160; BY ITS ACQUISITION HEREOF, THE HOLDER (1) REPRESENTS THAT (A) IT IS A &#8220;QUALIFIED INSTITUTIONAL BUYER&#8221;
      (AS DEFINED IN RULE 144A UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT), OR (B) IT IS NOT A U.S. PERSON AND IS ACQUIRING THIS SECURITY IN AN OFFSHORE TRANSACTION IN COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATION S UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT, (2) AGREES THAT IT WILL NOT WITHIN [IN THE CASE OF
      RULE 144A NOTES:&#160; ONE YEAR] [IN THE CASE OF REGULATION S NOTES:&#160; 40 DAYS] AFTER THE LATER OF THE ORIGINAL ISSUE DATE HEREOF AND THE LAST DATE ON WHICH THE ISSUER OR ANY AFFILIATE OF THE ISSUER WAS THE OWNER OF THIS SECURITY (OR ANY PREDECESSOR OF
      SUCH SECURITY) RESELL OR OTHERWISE TRANSFER THIS SECURITY EXCEPT (A) TO THE ISSUER OR ANY SUBSIDIARY THEREOF, (B) INSIDE THE UNITED STATES TO A QUALIFIED INSTITUTIONAL BUYER IN COMPLIANCE WITH RULE 144A UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT OR TO AN INSTITUTIONAL
      &#8220;ACCREDITED INVESTOR&#8221; (AS DEFINED IN RULE 501(A)(1), (2), (3) OR (7) OF REGULATION D UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT), (C) OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES IN AN OFFSHORE TRANSACTION IN COMPLIANCE WITH RULE 903 OR RULE 904 UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT, (D) PURSUANT TO
      THE EXEMPTION FROM REGISTRATION PROVIDED BY RULE 144 UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT (IF AVAILABLE), (E) IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANOTHER EXEMPTION FROM THE REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS OF THE SECURITIES ACT (AND BASED UPON AN OPINION OF COUNSEL IF THE ISSUER SO
      REQUESTS), OR (F) PURSUANT TO AN EFFECTIVE REGISTRATION STATEMENT UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT AND (3) AGREES THAT IT WILL GIVE TO EACH PERSON TO WHOM THIS SECURITY IS TRANSFERRED A NOTICE SUBSTANTIALLY TO THE EFFECT OF THIS LEGEND.&#160; AS USED HEREIN, THE
      TERMS &#8220;OFFSHORE TRANSACTION,&#8221; &#8220;UNITED STATES&#8221; AND &#8220;U.S. PERSON&#8221; HAVE THE MEANING GIVEN TO THEM BY REGULATION S UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT.]</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>[<font style="font-style: italic;">GLOBAL NOTES ONLY</font>] [UNLESS THIS CERTIFICATE IS PRESENTED BY AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF THE DEPOSITORY TRUST COMPANY, A NEW YORK CORPORATION (&#8220;DTC&#8221;), NEW YORK, NEW YORK, TO THE COMPANY OR ITS AGENT FOR
      REGISTRATION OF TRANSFER, EXCHANGE OR PAYMENT, AND ANY CERTIFICATE ISSUED IS REGISTERED IN THE NAME OF CEDE &amp; CO. OR SUCH OTHER NAME AS IS REQUESTED BY AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF DTC (AND ANY PAYMENT IS MADE TO CEDE &amp; CO., OR TO SUCH
      OTHER ENTITY AS IS REQUESTED BY AN AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF DTC), ANY TRANSFER, PLEDGE OR OTHER USE HEREOF FOR VALUE OR OTHERWISE BY OR TO ANY PERSON IS WRONGFUL INASMUCH AS THE REGISTERED OWNER HEREOF, CEDE &amp; CO., HAS AN INTEREST HEREIN.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>

      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">

    <div style="text-align: center;">(REVERSE OF NOTE)</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-align: center;">SOLVENTUM CORPORATION</div>
    <div style="text-align: center;">5.900% Senior Notes due 2054</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zbaa8898143c447748c17798da675a6e4" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">1.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Interest</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Solventum Corporation (the &#8220;<u>Company</u>&#8221;) promises to pay interest on the principal amount of this Note at the rate per annum described above.&#160; Cash interest on the Notes will accrue from, and including, the most
      recent date to which interest has been paid; or, if no interest has been paid, from February 27, 2024.&#160; Interest on this Note will be paid to, but excluding, the relevant Interest Payment Date or on such earlier date as the principal amount shall
      become due in accordance with the provisions hereof.&#160; The Company will pay interest semi-annually in arrears on each Interest Payment Date, beginning on October 30, 2024, and on the Stated Maturity.&#160; If any Interest Payment Date, Stated Maturity or
      other payment date with respect to the Notes is not a Business Day, then payment of principal, premium, if any, and interest shall be made on the next succeeding Business Day with the same force and effect as if made on the date such payment was due,
      and no interest on such payment shall accrue on that payment for the period from and after such Interest Payment Date, Stated Maturity or other payment date, as the case may be, to the date of that payment on the next succeeding Business Day.&#160;
      Interest will be computed on the basis of a 360-day year consisting of twelve 30-day months.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Company shall pay interest on overdue principal from time to time on demand at the rate borne by the Notes and at the same rate on overdue installments of interest (without regard to any applicable grace periods) to
      the extent lawful from the dates such amounts are due until such amounts are paid or made available for payment.&#160; All references to any amount of interest or any other amount payable on or with respect to the Notes shall be deemed to include payment
      of any interest payable as a consequence of the occurrence and continuation of a &#8220;Registration Default,&#8221; if applicable, as defined in the Registration Rights Agreement, dated as February 27, 2024, among the Company, the Guarantor and the
      representatives of the initial purchasers with respect to the Initial Notes party thereto.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zb8d4d283ba6143d1b93bfdd45440d9f8" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">2.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Paying Agent</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Initially, U.S. Bank Trust Company, National Association (the &#8220;<u>Trustee</u>&#8221;) will act as paying agent.&#160; The Company may change any paying agent without notice to the Holders.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zddab79c769ec4c04be2c9a4a8901b4a1" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">3.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Indenture; Defined Terms</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">This Note is one of the 5.900% Senior Notes due 2054 (the &#8220;<u>Notes</u>&#8221;) issued under the Indenture, dated as of February 27, 2024 (as amended, modified or supplemented from time to time in accordance therewith, the &#8220;<u>Base



        Indenture</u>&#8221; and, as supplemented by the First Supplemental Indenture, dated as of February 27, 2024, the &#8220;<u>Indenture</u>&#8221;), by and between the Company and the Trustee, as trustee.&#160; This Note is a &#8220;Security&#8221; and the Notes are &#8220;Securities&#8221; under
      the Indenture.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
        <hr noshade="noshade" style="margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; border-width: 0; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; clear: both;"></div>
    </div>
    <!--PROfilePageNumberReset%Num%2%-%-%-->
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">For purposes of this Note, unless otherwise defined herein, capitalized terms herein are used as defined in the Indenture.&#160; The terms of the Notes include those stated in the Indenture and those made part of the
      Indenture by reference to the Trust Indenture Act of 1939 (15 U.S.C. Sections 77aaa-77bbbb) (the &#8220;<u>TIA</u>&#8221;) as in effect on the date on which the Indenture is qualified under the TIA.&#160; Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Notes are
      subject to all such terms, and holders of Notes are referred to the Indenture and the TIA for a statement of them.&#160; To the extent the terms of the Indenture and this Note are inconsistent, the terms of the Indenture shall govern.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zce433be38eeb46c4893597102efb999a" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">4.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Denominations; Transfer; Exchange</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Notes are in registered form, without coupons, in denominations of $2,000 and integral multiples of $1,000 in excess thereof.&#160; A Holder shall register the transfer or exchange of Notes in accordance with the
      Indenture.&#160; The Company may require a Holder, among other things, to furnish appropriate endorsements and transfer documents and to pay certain transfer taxes or similar governmental charges payable in connection therewith as permitted by the
      Indenture.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zce4b5abd0bde4ba2a398965e65fcb45b" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">5.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Amendment; Modification; Waiver</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Subject to certain exceptions, with the consent of the Holders of not less than a majority in principal amount of the Outstanding Securities of all series affected by such supplemental indenture or amendment (treated as
      one class), by Act of said Holders delivered to the Company and the Trustee, the Company, when authorized by a Board Resolution, and the Trustee may enter into an indenture or indentures supplemental to the Indenture and/or amendments to any related
      guarantee agreement for the purpose of adding any provisions to or changing in any manner or eliminating any of the provisions of the Indenture or any such guarantee agreement or of modifying in any manner the rights of the Holders of Securities of
      such series under the Indenture or any such guarantee agreement.&#160; Without notice to or the consent of any Holder, the Company and the Trustee may amend or supplement the Indenture or the Notes to, among other things, cure any ambiguity, or correct or
      supplement any provision therein which may be defective or inconsistent with any other provision therein.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z454f623dc8f54aa68ae9c55fd661f387" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">6.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Optional Redemption; Special Mandatory Redemption; Offer to Repurchase Upon Change of Control Repurchase Event</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Notes are subject to optional redemption, special mandatory redemption and may be the subject of a Change of Control Offer, in each case as further described in the Indenture.&#160; There is no sinking fund applicable to
      the Notes.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z3050499fb58c449f944ea82aeaba4ef8" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">7.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Defaults and Remedies</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">If an Event of Default with respect to the Notes occurs and is continuing, then in every such case the Trustee or the Holders of not less than 25% in principal amount of the Outstanding Notes may declare the principal
      amount of all the Notes to be due and payable immediately, by a notice in writing to the Company (and to the Trustee if given by Holders), and upon any such declaration such principal amount (or specified amount) shall become immediately due and
      payable.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div class="BRPFPageBreakArea" style="clear: both; margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;">
      <div style="text-align: center;" class="BRPFPageNumberArea"><font style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal;">-2-</font></div>
      <div class="BRPFPageBreak" style="page-break-after: always;">
        <hr noshade="noshade" style="margin: 4px 0px; width: 100%; border-width: 0; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000; clear: both;"></div>
    </div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">The Indenture permits, subject to certain limitations therein provided, Holders of not less than a majority in principal amount of the Outstanding Notes to direct the time, method and place of conducting any proceeding
      for any remedy available to the Trustee, or exercising any trust or power conferred on the Trustee, with respect to the Notes.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z5fbacaf7eb564df89a6b841957b5c395" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">8.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Authentication</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">This Note shall not be valid until the Trustee or any Authenticating Agent signs the certificate of authentication on this Note by manual or PDF or other electronically imaged (such as DocuSign or Adobe Sign) signature.</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="zb11ff6c664954f69988b1c3aa324ed45" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

        <tr>
          <td style="width: 36pt;"><br>
          </td>
          <td style="width: 36pt; vertical-align: top;">9.</td>
          <td style="width: auto; vertical-align: top;">
            <div style="font-size: 12pt;"><font style="font-size: 10pt;"><u>Abbreviations and Defined Terms</u>.</font></div>
          </td>
        </tr>

    </table>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Customary abbreviations may be used in the name of a Holder of a Note or an assignee, such as:&#160; TEN COM (= tenants in common), TEN ENT (= tenants by the entireties), JT TEN (= joint tenants with right of survivorship and
      not as tenants in common), CUST (= Custodian), and U/G/M/A (= Uniform Gifts to Minors Act).</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" id="z321e0d1a98d946c3ad7ff6d2ce4b30e3" class="DSPFListTable" style="font-family: 'Times New Roman'; font-size: 10pt; width: 100%; text-align: left; color: #000000;">

          </td>

    </table>

    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">No representation is made as to the accuracy of CUSIP or ISIN numbers as printed on the Notes.</div>

    <div style="text-indent: 72pt;">Unless one of the boxes is checked, the Trustee will refuse to register any of the Notes evidenced by this certificate in the name of any Person other than the registered Holder thereof; <u>provided</u>, <u>however</u>,
      that if box (5), (6), (7) or (8) is checked, the Company or the Trustee may require, prior to registering any such transfer of the Notes, such legal opinions, certifications and other information as the Company or the Trustee has reasonably requested
      to confirm that such transfer is being made pursuant to an exemption from, or in a transaction not subject to, the registration requirements of the Securities Act.</div>
